description:
Megaspectre is a Battlezone-influenced 3D tank combat game set in a cyberpunk environment. It is a straightforward tank battle game with simple controls and progressive waves of action.

The player can choose from three tanks with different performance characteristics. Gameplay involves destroying enemy tanks which come in progressively more difficult waves. Powerups scattered throughout the stylized levels are used to repair your tank and get more weapons.
title: Megaspectre

description:
In the beginning of the 21st century, the Earth has reached an unseen level of technological progress. However, the environmental damage has also increased beyond anything the human had imagined. It was then that the disaster occurred: a huge floating fortress appeared on the Earth's orbit, and the self-proclaimed "Beast Empire" of monsters began invading the planet. Soon, a whole continent was destroyed. Humanity was on the verge of destruction. Only a special unit of agents trained and infused with the latest bio- and technological achievements can stop the monster invasion. The leader of this organization sends a group under the command of the young soldier Abel to investigate a location where the previously sent team disappeared without trace...

Abel is a turn-based Japanese-style RPG set in a dark futuristic environment. The player commands Abel and his teammates from the headquarters, where they can rest, receive items, and prepare for the next mission. The missions themselves take place in large dungeon-like areas. Randomly appearing enemies must be defeated in first-person perspective combat with a rather standard system: characters either attack physically, use items, or execute special attacks that require "special points" (equivalent to magic). There is also an Auto option for battles.

sample_screenshots.caption: A new character joins the party

title: Abel: Shin Mokushiroku Taisen

description: Rayxanber is a horizontally scrolling shooter in which the player controls an aircraft protecting the Earth from the evil alien Zoul Empire. The Zoul civilization is biomechanic, and their organic ships pose unseen threat to our planet. The game follows a traditional side-scrolling shoot-em-up template, and is similar to Gradius and R-Type. The player has to survive an onslaught of continuously appearing biomechanic ships and destroy large organic fortresses in boss battles. The player is also able to collect elemental power-ups which will change the properties of the ship's weapons.

sample_screenshots.caption: Stage 3 takes place inside some kind of organic body
Stage 4 boss goes by the name, and I kid you not, "Hammy-Scuff"
Third boss who by the looks of it, lives up to its name

title: Rayxanber

description: Genocide Square includes re-mastered versions of two games, Genocide and Genocide 2. The second game contains minor differences compared to the original, primarily in enemy design. The first game, however, has undergone more significant gameplay-related changes. The difficulty level has been reduced, and the powerful capsule weapon Betty is available to the protagonist from the beginning (as opposed to mid-game in the original release).

sample_screenshots.caption: Genocide 2: be careful, those cylinders will squash you
Genocide 2: capitalism seems to be an issue here

title: Genocide² - Genocide Square

description:
Alice no Yakata CD contains the mini-games included in Alice no Yakata. In addition, it includes full versions of two games:

  • Intruder: Sakura Yashiki no Tansaku
  • Crescent Moon Girl

sample_screenshots.caption: Crescent Moon Girl: oh no... poor cat...
Crescent Moon Girl: one of the girls in the dormitory
Each of the two games is at first presented with a release summary

title: Alice no Yakata CD

description:
Yami no Ketsuzoku Special contains two games:

  • Yami no Ketsuzoku
  • Yami no Ketsuzoku: Kanketsu-hen

Both titles are merged into a single game - the player can start the second chapter only after having completed the first. This version also replaces the synthesized music of the original release with CD audio tracks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Talking to the tea house owner

title: Yami no Ketsuzoku Special

description:
Zan II: Towns Special is an installment in the Zan series primarily based on Zan: Kagerō no Toki. The setting (Japanese Sengoku period) and main gameplay mechanics are identical. However, this version allows the player to recreate specific scenarios from the historical era, taking place between 1550 and 1600. Four scenarios of varied difficulty are available.

Like other Zan games, this entry is a turn-based grand strategy game similar to Koei's Romance of the Three Kingdoms series. The player takes control of a ruler or general in a chosen province of Japan, trying to govern his own country by keeping its inhabitants happy, and gaining the upper hand in the struggle for dominance, be it through diplomatic manoeuvres or military actions. Combat takes place on separate isometric screens and allows the player to input detailed commands for the army.
title: Zan II: Towns Special

description:
Linkage: The 4th Unit 1・2 Towns contains two games:

  • The 4th Unit
  • The 4th Unit 2

Visually, the games are identical to the respective Sharp X68000 versions. No further changes have been made either to the presentation or gameplay. The package also contains a demo recounting the events of both games, and a non-interactive short comic entitled "Prologue", depicting the occurrences prior to those of the first installment.

sample_screenshots.caption: The 4th Unit 2: new, very short intro

title: Linkage: The 4th Unit 1・2 Towns

description:
Merrygoround is the sixth installment of The 4th Unit series and a sequel to D-Again, being the second chapter of the Einheit story arc introduced in the previous game. Koshinaka's research of the data bank on board the Diabolique, a stealth aircraft carrier of the United Nations, is aimed at increasing the life adjustment factor of bionic soldiers. However, members of the Einheit assault the laboratory, and the bionic soldier Blon-Win must decipher the clues left in order to proceed with the research and confront a mysterious person named Rua Rip Salisbury in the Original Matrix.

Gameplay-wise, this installment is a departure from any format introduced in the previous entries. It is essentially an interactive movie with semi-animated voiced cutscenes occupying the bulk of the game. The player is required to choose the correct character and perform the correct action within a time limit during each scene. Failing to comply with the time limit will subtract a small quantity of the "Life" bar, while choosing a wrong action will normally reduce it by an even larger amount. Once the Life bar is depleted the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Quick, choose the right character and action!

title: Merrygoround: The 4th Unit Series

description:
Judge Badnack, one of the few remnants of the WWWF, is determined to restore that criminal organization to former glory. He takes control of the assault satellite belonging to the United Nations, and kidnaps Zero to attain his goal. However, the Einheit organization sends Badnack's ex-lover Arnette Penzias to further their own agenda. Blon-Win and Dalzy must once again use their wits and their bionic powers to rescue Zero and put an end to evil schemes.

Wyatt is the seventh entry in The 4th Unit series and a sequel to Merrygoround. Gameplay-wise, it is similar to its immediate predecessor, with presentation and gameplay elements reminiscent of an interactive cartoon. Like in the previous game, the player must select actions within time limit to advance the story, and may run out of "lives" if the time limit has been breached or too many wrong choices were made. Unlike the predecessor, possible actions are performed with command icons rather than selection from text menus.

sample_screenshots.caption: The gameplay begins right with Dalzy
Something bad is going to happen...

title: Wyatt: The 4th Unit Series

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Air Combat II (base game)
  • Air Combat II: Scenario Collection (add-on)
  • Air Combat II: Scenario Collection vol.2 (add-on)

sample_screenshots.caption: At night, flying over shallow water

title: Air Combat II Special

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Hacchake Ayayo-san
  • Hacchake Ayayo-san II: Ikenai Holiday
  • Hacchake Ayayo-san III: Watashi, Icchatta n' desu

The first two games allow the player to choose between the ports of the respective versions for PC-88 and Sharp X68000, the latter having technically higher-quality visuals.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ayayo 3: A sex lesson in school
Ayayo 1: PC-88 version - choosing the otehr option doesn't change the plot much
Ayayo 2: PC-88 version - Tomoko has sex
Ayayo 2: Sharp X68000 version - Tomoko is getting some

title: A 1-2-3

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Cal
  • Cal II

The second game can be started only after having completed the first one.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cal: a rare scene without the protagonist

title: Cal Towns

description:
Gekirin is a self-described "RPG without a story". The player takes the role of a nameless male adventurer in an abstract medieval town, equipped with basic weapons and armor. The bulk of the game takes place in a gigantic multi-story overhead randomly generated dungeon. The protagonist explores the dungeon in search of a precious sword, descending deeper and deeper, looting treasure chests, and fighting respawning enemies in action-oriented combat, which grants him experience points.

Ranged and melee weapons are available, as well as attack items (bombs etc.) and special items (such as keys that unlock new areas). Equipment and items can be bought in the town's stores. The hero's weapons and armor rapidly deteriorate and must be repaired or exchanged for new ones when their rating reaches zero. It is also possible to attack walls, carving alternate pathways through the dungeon. When the protagonist dies he is teleported back to the town and the player can attempt to tackle the dungeon again.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can store your stuff here
You found an elevator to another floor
The game starts right here, in the hero's house. No intro, no story, no explanation, no nothing

title: Gekirin: Ushinawareshi Hōken

description:
Years have passed since the brave young hero vanquished hordes of monsters and obtained the legendary sword. The hero used its power to build the country of everyone's dreams, where peace and prosperity reigned supreme. However, an evil magician has usurped the power of the sword and used it to unleash monster minions on the kingdom. A new hero has risen, determined to enter the depths of the dungeon and rid the land of evil.

The sequel to Gekirin is nearly identical to its predecessor gameplay-wise. Like the previous game, it is an action-oriented dungeon crawler that predominantly takes place in randomized mazes full of respawning enemies. All the features of the original game - breakable weapons, magic, destructible walls, etc. - return in the sequel. New weapons, armor, and item types have been added.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here you can store a surplus of items
This elf sells some interesting stuff

title: Die Gekirin

description: Evolution is a simple first-person perspective 3D shooter set in an abstract environment. The protagonist represents an evolving creature who must survive an onslaught of other organisms. Forward movement is automatic, but the player-controlled character can move up, down, and to the sides. The gameplay consists solely of shooting enemies, which increases the player's score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting with level 3 you have to memorize the correct route

title: Evolution

description:
Joshi Kōsei Shōjo Hatsunetsu is an erotic game with digitized pictures of Japanese models posing as schoolgirls. The game consists of three modes. The first mode allows the player to view profiles and photos of twelve models (five photos per model). These photos are sexually suggestive, but contain no nudity. It is possible to interact with the pictures by moving a hand-shaped cursor over them.

The second mode is a photo-shooting simulation game in which the player chooses one of the four available models as well as one of the several photographers, each with their own parameters. The session is timed and the photographer has to choose the right things to say in order to keep the girl in a good mood. Erotic photos (this time with partial nudity) can be then taken and saved to an album.

The third mode is a simple sex simulation game. The player chooses between two young women, selects a few conditions for the sex scene, and then presses various keys to stimulate the woman. There is, however, no explicit sex situations in the game, the viewing area consisting only of a digitized photo of a semi- or fully nude woman.

sample_screenshots.caption: That will make a great picture for the school newspaper
Waiting for the model to arrive... time passes
Choosing one of the two girls
Some models start with seductive photos right away

title: Joshi Kōsei Shōjo Hatsunetsu

description: Kyan Kyan Collection is similar in concept to an earlier game with the same name, being a strip Daifugō card game. However, the opponents are different, and rather than selecting them from the main menu the player faces them one after the other in a linear fashion. The graphics are also completely different, and the girls' undressing scenes are animated. This release also has a much lower difficulty level.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...and has every reason to be so

title: Kyan Kyan Collection

description:
Hong Kong no Mashu is based on the manga Lupin the 3rd and is built like an episode in the series, assuming the player's familiarity with the characters. The central character is the grandson of the fictional "gentleman thief" Arsène Lupin, who follows the same profession, traveling in search of riches and adventure with his companion Daisuke Jigen, an expert marksman. Joining them in this episode is Goemon Ishikawa XIII, a descendant of the legendary Japanese swordsman. Finding themselves in Hong Kong for different reasons, the heroes encounter an evasive and mysterious character with a dark past who crosses their paths and forces them to take action.

The game consists of two stories accessible from the main menu. In the first the player controls Jigen, while the protagonist of the second is Ishikawa. The game's structure resembles that of a visual novel: the gameplay is mostly restricted to selecting the right choice among several available ones. These decision prompts are fairly frequent, and making the wrong choice would sometimes lead to Game Over. In addition, in the beginning of each chapter the player must select three items from a list, which will become available as valid choices during correspondent scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: The busy streets of Hong Kong

title: Lupin Sansei: Hong Kong no Mashu - Fukushū wa Meikyū no Hate ni

description:
In the future, remains of a mysterious, highly advanced ancient civilization were discovered in a cave on a deserted planet. A unique material was found there, which could spontaneously change shape and morph into complete products by itself. Humans were able to harvest the technology, but an accident destroyed the source. The player takes the role of a pilot who must venture to dangerous areas of space in order to discover possible additional sources of the material.

MegaMorph is a third-person perspective arcade-style shooter, similar in concept and gameplay to Microcosm and Novastorm. The backgrounds consists entirely out of full-motion video sequences. Forward movement is on rails, but the player can move the craft in four directions. The craft can defend itself with regular fire with unlimited ammunition, or drop a limited supply of missiles. Stages typically culminate with boss battles.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...and found remains of a highly advanced ancient civilization
FM Towns Marty controller. Sure, why not

title: MegaMorph

description:
Misty is a detective mystery adventure game set in modern-day Japan and starring the young private investigator Ryū Kamishiro. The game consists of nine unrelated cases that can be accessed in any order from the main menu. These cases range from seemingly mundane matters to thefts, mysterious disappearances and murder investigations.

This installment in the series differs from the others by introducing full-screen digitized photos for all the locations (as opposed to the text-only majority of other Misty releases). There are also many more unique images instead of generic areas as well as hand-drawn character graphics in many scenes.

This release contains all the five cases of Misty Vol.1: Strange Naked Body, Red Fountain, Murderer's Laboratory, Tail Lights Disappearing in the Old City and Decaying Family Tree. In addition, it contains four cases exclusive to this version: Moving Target, The Young Lady's Abduction, Letter from the Red Spider and Final Countdown.

The player is presented with a graphical map of locations in the city, and much of the gameplay is dedicated to repeatedly visiting them, searching areas and questioning suspects. The gameplay is somewhat more relenting than in other Misty games, allowing re-visiting more locations without penalties.

It is possible to accuse suspects and attempt to solve the case at any point, though doing so without sufficient evidence will result in failure. The game saves the progress automatically; it is possible to restart the investigation only by deleting the save file.

sample_screenshots.caption: The map is the same for most cases

title: Misty

description:
Hyper Classic Operation is a turn-based sci-fi strategy game focusing entirely on battles between the Earth Federation and Zeon. The game has two campaigns, 0079 and 0087, corresponding to the years in which two major wars of the Gundam universe took place: the first war against the Principality of Zeon and the conflict between various factions (including the Axis Zeon, the first of the Neo Zeon organizations) eight years later. The player can either go through the battles of each campaign in a linear fashion (Campaign Mode), or choose between different battles (Scenario Mode); the latter includes two-player gameplay as well.

The player may assign and customize various pilots before each battle. The battles themselves are predominantly tactical, consisting mainly of navigation and attacking, without resource management. Units may consist of space ships, infantry, droids, mechas, etc. An automatic battle between two units ensues when any of them chooses to attack the other. There are also light role-playing elements such as levels for individual units.

sample_screenshots.caption: Due to my laziness the enemy has formed this circle

title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Hyper Classic Operation

description:
Hyper Desert Operation can be considered a "twin game" of Mobile Suit Gundam: Hyper Classic Operation. It is nearly identical to the other game in setting, gameplay, and visuals. Like Hyper Classic Operation, the game consists of two major campaigns, 0079 and 0087, corresponding to two famous wars in Gundam universe. The player can once again choose between a linear progression through a campaign and individual scenarios within each.

The scenarios themselves, however, are completely different. Unlike Hyper Classic Operation, all the scenarios take place on planet surfaces rather than in space. As the title suggests, desert terrain plays indeed an important role; however, some of the scenarios are set in grassland areas, sometimes surrounded by water, etc. The game also features different unit types and places a stronger emphasis on base defense and management.
title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Hyper Desert Operation

description:
In the year 19XX, a huge meteorite fell upon Tokyo. Within a short time the entire city was destroyed. Due to unforeseen radioactivity and diseases spread by a new virus, the survivors have turned into horrifying mutants, and corpses were reanimated as zombies. The few remaining humans had to live underground, from where they attempt to continue their resistance. Keiko Kirihara, the only female member of their small armed force, is sent to find a route to a safer location, which lies in the city's dangerous areas.

Rejection is a hybrid of a shooter and a role-playing game. The entire game is viewed from first-person perspective, and much of it is spent in maze-like areas. It cannot be considered a first-person shooter in the sense of Wolfenstein 3D, however, since the graphics are pseudo-3D and the movement is step-based and not fluent. Keiko can use a variety of firearms and melee weapons (such as knives). Health kits and ammunition can be found in the stages. Enemies would often respawn to give the player the opportunity to level up Keiko, since experience points are awarded for defeating them.

sample_screenshots.caption: This guy has a lot on his mind...

title: Rejection: Den-No Senshi

description: This release of Gibo: Sayaka also includes the full version of Miho Premium Collection no.003. Both games are on one CD and can be accessed directly from the main menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choose any of the two games

title: Sayaka & Miho

description:
Super Shooting Towns is a fairly simple horizontally-scrolling shooter. The player controls a flying mechanical bug-like device that has to fight its way through levels populated by various organic (predominantly insect-like) creatures. There is no permanent secondary weapon, and the relatively infrequent power-ups may either switch the properties of the main weapon temporarily or enhance it (e.g. enable backwards shooting).

The game's stand-out feature is the included editor. This utility allows players to design and customize their own side-scrolling shooter levels. It is possible to draw maps as well as change the parameters of the enemies, affecting the difficulty of the stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first thing that loads off the CD is this menu

title: Super Shooting Towns

description:
Custom Mate 2 & Itsuka Dokoka de compiles two adult hentai games formerly released on the PC-98: Custom Mate 2 and Itsuka Dokoka de.

Both games play similarly to their original versions and can be chosen from a menu appearing when the game boots.

sample_screenshots.caption: [Itsuka Dokoka de.] She don't look too happy though
[Itsuka Dokoka de.] Third story, that's not what a microphone is for but don't let me stop you
[Custom Mate 2] And I would have gotten away with it too, if it weren't for that chainsmoking undercover cop masquerading as a school girl

title: Custom Mate 2 & Itsuka Dokoka de.

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Custom Mate
  • Erotic Baka Novel: Denwa no Bell ga...
title: Custom Mate & Denwa no Bell ga...

description:
Excellent 10 is a compilation of ten vertically scrolling shoot' em ups, made with the shooting game creation software Shooting Towns. The ten games included are:

  • Neo Tard
  • Beams
  • Brenner
  • Dernus
  • The Desert Rally
  • Fantasia
  • Last Fight
  • Peace
  • Return Earth
  • System AICA (Armed Industral Cybernetic Autobot)
title: Excellent 10

description:
CRI Gokan Pack is a compilation containing 5 Sega arcade ports:

  • After Burner
  • After Burner III
  • Turbo OutRun
  • Galaxy Force II
  • Last Survivor
title: CRI Gokan Pack

description: Ryūtōden is a two player variant of Activision's Shanghai puzzle game also known as solitaire mahjong. The goal is to remove all 144 tiles by matching them into pairs, but only tiles which are visible and have a space to the left or right can be removed. The game features four different tile sets and player(s) can choose to display hints or reverse moves. A mode with a time limit (either 15, 10 or 6 minutes) is available as well.

sample_screenshots.caption: Settings menu, by clicking on the icon - speaker with the American flag you can listen to Brad Fregger talk about this game
Clicking the eye icon will highlight a pair of tiles that are available for removal
Playing with a 15 minute time limit

title: Ryūtōden

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Himitsu no Hanazono
  • Kimi Dake ni Ai o...
  • Dragon Eyes

There's also a bonus section featuring a cyber novel called "miły -aisuruhito-" which serves as a parallel story to Dragon Eyes, "Music Room" allows you to listen to games music tracks, while in "Bishōjo overview 1" you can view profiles of the various female characters from the games.

sample_screenshots.caption: [Himitsu no Hanazono] it's only a dream
[Kimi Dake ni Ai o] naughty doctor

title: Game Technopolis Super Collection 1

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Tesera Kimi wa Kegareta Tenshi ka Seinaru Majo ka!?
  • Hatsukoi Monogatari

There's also a bonus section featuring the CD drama "Dennō Tenshi Episode 1: Tenshi daten-shi yattekita!", "Music Room 2" allows you to listen to games music tracks, "Bishōjo overview 2" has profiles of the various female characters from the games, plus a wallpaper collection.

sample_screenshots.caption: [Tesera Kimi wa Kegareta Tenshi ka Seinaru Majo ka!?]
One of the pictures in 32,768 color mode
Wallpaper section has five pictures in 16 color mode, while the rest are in 32,768 color mode
One of the 16 color pictures, this one is from Himitsu no Hanazono

title: Game Technopolis Super Collection 2

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Solitaire Royale
  • Puppy Love

sample_screenshots.caption: [Puppy Love] Trophy Room displays the 3 "Hot Dogging" ribbons
Compilation boots into TownsOS, here you can choose which game to play, read their manuals or watch sample
[Solitaire Royale] in the settings you can change the background color
[Puppy Love] in "Top Dogging" events your pup needs to perform a choreographed routine containing certain tricks; three judges then score it from 0 to 9.9

title: PI's Solitaire Royale / Tom Snyder's Puppy Love

description: Asuka 120% Excellent BURNING Fest. is a 2D versus fighting game. It is essentially an upgrade of Asuka 120% BURNING Fest. featuring more zoomed-in visuals thus bigger character sprites, new moves, as well as CD Red Book audio. This version also has adventure/visual novel elements in the story mode and the option to choose between three speed settings. The fighter roster and stages remain unchanged.

sample_screenshots.caption: Options menu, new for this version is the speed setting
Story mode now has adventure/visual novel elements
Character select screen has different portraits

title: Asuka 120% Excellent BURNING Fest.

description:
The release of Can Can Bunny Premiere for FM Towns also comes with the previous game in the series. It contains:

  • Can Can Bunny Premiere
  • Can Can Bunny: Spirits

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu; select top left option to play Premiere or top right to play Spirits
Spirits; introducing the women and their "stats"

title: Can Can Bunny Premiere

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Joker
  • Joker II

The second game can be started only after having completed the first one.

sample_screenshots.caption: [Joker] For some reason Laura is unable to see into the future
You can listen to the game's background music tracks
[Joker] The church is the only place where you can save your game, it’s also a pun, that you have been saved when you talk to the priest

title: Joker Towns

description:
Alltynex is a vertically-scrolling shoot' em up. It's a doujin game developed by Satoshi Yoshida in 1996. He entered it in the 2nd ASCII Entertainment Software Contest (also known as A-con) held in 1996 and won the prize in the PC software category. As a result, the game was included on a CD that came with the magazine Login Softcon. In 1997 version 1.01 was released as freeware on the developer's website.

The story is about a supercomputer ALLTYNEX that goes rogue and decides to wage a war on all of mankind. The player controls a fighter spacecraft which can also transform into a mecha that has more powerful weapons but is generally slower. The standard fighter has an upgradeable spread shot and the secondary weapon is a homing laser. In mecha form there's a very powerful but short range sword while the secondary weapon is a big laser. Secondary weapons use an energy meter that drains as the weapon is fired. It charges as more things are destroyed or damaged. Also, as long as the player has collected at least one main weapon power-up, the first enemy hit will not destroy the player's craft, but instead reduce power-up level to zero. There are five stages in total. Two player mode is also available.

The game was remade with polygonal graphics as Alltynex Second, released on August 14, 2010 at Summer Comiket 78.

sample_screenshots.caption: Option screen; note the typos: "nomal" and "harf"

title: Alltynex

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Pocky
  • Pocky 2: Kaijin Aka Manto no Chōsen
  • Ponyon

sample_screenshots.caption: [CG Collection] This one is from Pocky 2
Select which game to play, there's also 2 extras: CG Collection and Errands Combat
[Pocky 2] Intro: photographing secret documents with the world's most famous spy camera - Minox
CG Collection has graphics from various Ponytail Soft games, like this one from Ponyon

title: Pocky 1・2 & Ponyon

description:
Steepia LITE, as the name suggests, is an abridged version of Steepia (a.k.a. Heaven & Earth) omitting the pendulums and cards game. Leaving the 12 Illusions puzzle games:

  • Figure Ground
  • Convex/Concave
  • Regrouping
  • Anti-Maze
  • Fit Fall
  • Cursor Warping
  • Multiple Cursors
  • Sliding Graphics
  • Flip Turn
  • Gaining/Losing
  • Identity Maze
  • Changing Bodies
title: Steepia Lite
